summary: A simple mesh swap, by request.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/UJ12AJk.png[/img][/center]
[center][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/65163/?][img]http://i.imgur.com/QtD7v94.png[/img][/url][/center]

Do you love your cool [url=http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Dragonbone_Arrow]dragonbone arrows[/url], but hate how they look like some kind of 3-prong eating utensil? Fret no more! After a request, I made this quick fix to solve this issue. DAWNGUARD REQUIRED!

I went looking in the files and noticed that the [url=http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Steel_Arrow_(Skyrim)]steel arrow[/url] mesh works alright with the Dragonbone arrow texture, so I simply made a copy, fixed the texture paths, and here we are. You can see a comparison picture up there. Of course, it's nothing amazing, but it should be good enough until someone more skilled comes along.

This is compatible with custom retextures, but not mesh replacements. An example of this would be [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/37358/?]Ultimate Spinning Arrows[/url]. If you have that mod installed, you could follow the steps I listed above to make them compatible.

Looking for a replacement for the daedric arrows? Take a look [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/31864/?]here[/url]! And you can find another nice replacement for the dragonbone arrow [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52505/?]here[/url].

To install, extract the contents of your downloaded file to your "Steam/SteamApps/Common/Skyrim/Data" folder. That's it, no esp required. Have fun!


[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/UJ12AJk.png[/img][/center]
author: Jokerine
